#Text=West Iceland
#Text=West Iceland ( Icelandic : Vesturland ) is the region of Iceland north of the capital .
#Text=Towns
#Text=Listed from south to north .
#Text=– a town by Borgarfjörður about an hour and a half from Reykjavík by car .

#Text=It used to be a service centre for the neighboring farming communities , but has a developed tourist industry and is a good place to stay for those wanting to get out of Reykjavík while remaining close to the southwest corner .
#Text=–
#Text=the largest town on Snæfellsnes and gateway to the islands of Breiðafjörður .
#Text=Has many houses of Danish influence dating back to the 18th and 19th centuries .
#Text=– to the west of Stykkishólmur , on the north coast of Snæfellsnes .
#Text=, Rif and Ólafsvík – three villages on the western end of Snæfellsnes , close to Snæfellsjökull and the national park .
#Text=– small village in Dalirnir , known for its cheese production .
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=– former home of Snorri Sturluson , medieval poet , author and chieftain .

#Text=- on the tip of the Snæfellsnes Peninsula in southern Iceland , this park is home to the ice-covered volcanic crater that was the setting for Jules Verne 's book Journey to the Center of the Earth .
#Text=– the largest island in Breiðafjörður , and the only one that is inhabited .
#Text=— A shield volcano and former glacier .

#Text=There is a memorial plaque for the glacier , dated 2019 , with the inscription " Ok is the first Icelandic glacier to lose its status as a glacier . In the next 200 years all our glaciers are expected to follow the same path . This monument is to acknowledge that we know what is happening and what needs to be done . Only you know if we did it . "
#Text=Understand
#Text=West Iceland can be split into four main areas .
#Text=Furthest north are Dalirnir ( The Valleys ) , a farming area mainly seen by tourists driving through on their way to North Iceland .
#Text=Dalirnir contain a remarkable natural phenomenon , though : The hills .
#Text=There are many of them .
#Text=Very many in fact .
#Text=And some of the hills have hills on top of them .
#Text=Icelandic legend has it that the hills are so many that they 're uncountable .
#Text=A second uncountable phenomenon is found to the west of Dalirnir .
#Text=Breiðafjörður is a large bay scattered with a supposedly uncountable number of small islands .
#Text=In earlier times these islands were all used for farming purposes , but today only one of them is inhabited , the island of Flatey .
#Text=South of Breiðafjörður is a large , long peninsula .
#Text=Snæfellsnes is one long mountain range with stunning , if barren , beauty .
#Text=Dotted along the coastline are fishing communities , with farming taking place on the little lowland regions found between the coast and the mountains .
#Text=Finally , to the south of Snæfellsnes , there is the farming area surrounding Borgarfjörður .
#Text=This is an important agricultural area , reaching far inland .
#Text=Borg , the farm after which both Borgarfjörður and the town of Borgarnes are named , was the home of Egill Skallagrímsson , the titular character of Egil 's Saga .
#Text=Further inland , Reykholt was home to Snorri Sturluson , one of the most important players in Iceland 's 14th-century civil war and chronicler of Norwegian kings .
#Text=Today the area is home to two universities , the Icelandic University of Agriculture and Bifröst University .
#Text=Get in
#Text=West Iceland is linked to Southwest and North Iceland via the ring road .
#Text=If you are arriving from Reykjavík , you will most likely go through a tunnel under Hvalfjörður ( the fjord marking the start of West Iceland ) .
#Text=This is the only toll road in Iceland , and for vehicles shorter than 6 meters each trip costs 1000 kr .
#Text=If you 'll be going back and forth a lot , there 's a discount card for ten trips at 6350 kr .
#Text=Whichever direction you 're driving , the toll booths are on the north .
#Text=An alternative to paying is to drive around Hvalfjörður .
#Text=It 's a scenic drive , and well worth it if you have the time .
#Text=Since the tunnel was built , the traffic levels are very low and sights include the country 's only whaling station in operation as well as innumerable waterfalls , mountains and rivers .
#Text=However it 's a long drive , 59 km , as opposed to the 6-km long tunnel .
#Text=If you 're arriving from the Westfjords , there are two roads , one on each coast of the peninsula that links the regions .
#Text=Or you can take a ferry from Brjánslækur , on the south coast of the Westfjords , called Baldur .
#Text=Brjánslækur is only a ferry port and the closest towns are Bíldudalur and Patreksfjörður , both around 50 km away .
#Text=The terminal on the West Iceland side of the route is Stykkishólmur on Snæfellsnes , with a stop in Flatey on the way .
#Text=There are no scheduled flights into West Iceland .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Roads mainly trace the coastline in West Iceland , with a few mountain passes and more inland roads in the rural area northeast of Borgarfjörður .
#Text=The Ring Road bypasses large sections of the region , including Snæfellsnes and Dalirnir , meaning traffic can be very light .
#Text=Although most roads are paved , the very tip of the Snæfellsnes peninsula is not , nor are some of the mountain passes .
#Text=In some places , the road on Snæfellsnes sits on a very narrow ledge , with a long and steep fall to the sea below .
#Text=Driving on your own is the most flexible way of getting around , but there are some bus routes operated by Straeto .
#Text=Hitch hiking is an option for those travelling by bus who want to reach destinations not served by the bus system .
#Text=To get to the islands of Breiðafjörður , a boat is needed .
#Text=Only Flatey is served by regular ferries from Stykkishólmur , crossing over to Brjánslækur on the south coast of the Westfjords .
#Text=If you wish to visit other islands you will need to arrange transportation locally , but frankly most of them are small and without much to see .
#Text=See
#Text=Natural beauty is the main attraction of the region , particularly Snæfellsnes and the islands of Breiðafjörður .
#Text=Deildartunguhver – Europe 's biggest hot spring , measured in amounts of water .
#Text=Close to Reykholt .
#Text=Snæfellsnes – a magnificent mountain range that forms a peninsula separating the bays of Faxaflói and Breiðafjörður .
#Text=A trip around the peninsula will allow you to see the ocean and the mountains .
#Text=Many waterfalls come out of the mountain cliffs and there are a number of beautiful rivers running from the mountains into the ocean .
